meanings.sent1: Eating a small snack may suffice to curb your hunger.
meanings.sent2: A single cup of sugar will suffice for the recipe.
meanings.sent3: I thought one slice of cake would suffice, but I ended up eating the whole thing!
meanings.sent4: His apology did not suffice to mend the broken trust between them.
meanings.sent5: A simple 'thank you' may suffice to show your appreciation.

meanings.definition: To meet the needs or requirements.
meanings.sent1: I hope this explanation will suffice to clarify any confusion.
meanings.sent2: We need to suffice the demands of our customers to keep them satisfied.
meanings.sent3: Trying to use a fork as a spoon did not suffice for eating soup.
meanings.sent4: Her efforts to suffice the expectations of her boss were recognized with a promotion.
meanings.sent5: A warm smile can suffice to brighten someone's day.
